data.title: Liverpool FC - statistics & facts
data.meta_description: Find the most up-to-date statistics and facts about Liverpool F.C.
data.text:
Liverpool FC is a professional football club based in Liverpool, England. The club, also known as the Reds, is one of the most popular teams in the Premier League, and one of the most successful teams in world football: Liverpool FC’s club honors include an impressive six UEFA Champions League titles, as well as 19 English top-flight titles. This sporting success has inevitably led to a high demand for tickets, with the most expensive season ticket at Liverpool FC costing 869 British pounds, or nearly 46 British pounds per game.

What is Liverpool FC’s annual revenue?

Liverpool is one of the football clubs with the highest revenue worldwide, generating a total of 701.7 million euros in the 2021/22 season. Such a high profile means the club is able to attract lucrative sponsors, with Liverpool FC’s revenue from shirt sponsorship amounting to 50 million British pounds a year. When looking at the breakdown of Liverpool FC’s revenue for 2021/22, the highest source of income was broadcasting payments, being worth over 310 million euros a year. This perhaps comes as no surprise - as well as competing in the Premier League, the club often competes in European cup competitions against other elite sides.

Who is Liverpool FC’s best player of all time?

Many footballing legends have played for the Reds over the years. Liverpool FC’s top scorer is Wales’s Ian Rush, who scored 346 goals for the club across all competitions. Meanwhile, the player with the most appearances for Liverpool FC is Ian Callaghan, who won two European Cups with the club in the mid-1970s. Nowadays, the team continues to have some of football’s most talented players, with the likes of Mohamed Salah and Virgil van Dijk exciting crowds on a weekly basis. Salah is also Liverpool FC’s highest earning player, with an estimated weekly salary of around 350,000 British pounds.
